requirement_tested: Interactive chessboard allowing users to move pieces according to chess rules
user_persona: A casual chess enthusiast playing a friend online.
user_goal: To make a valid move by dragging a piece to a legal square.

narrative_steps.title: Selecting a Piece
narrative_steps.description: Alex clicks on their white pawn at e2 to prepare for a move.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the pawn at e2.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The pawn is visually selected, and all legal moves are highlighted on the board.

narrative_steps.title: Dragging to Legal Square
narrative_steps.description: Alex drags the pawn from e2 to e4, a valid opening move.
narrative_steps.action: Drag the pawn from e2 to e4.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The pawn moves to e4, the board updates, and the move is sent to the backend for validation and synchronization.

requirement_tested: Functionality for users to create new chess games
user_persona: A player looking to start a fresh match.
user_goal: To create a new public game with default settings.

narrative_steps.title: Opening New Game Modal
narrative_steps.description: Jordan clicks the 'Create New Game' button from the dashboard.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Create New Game' button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A modal titled 'New Game Setup' appears with options for theme, difficulty, and privacy.

narrative_steps.title: Confirming Game Creation
narrative_steps.description: Jordan accepts the defaults and confirms creation.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Confirm' button in the modal.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A new game is created on the backend and Jordan is redirected to the game lobby waiting for an opponent.

requirement_tested: Functionality for users to join existing chess games
user_persona: A player searching for a quick match.
user_goal: To join an open game listed in the lobby.

narrative_steps.title: Viewing Available Games
narrative_steps.description: Taylor scrolls through the list of open games on the lobby page.
narrative_steps.action: Scroll down the list of available games.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: More games are loaded dynamically as Taylor reaches the end of the list.

narrative_steps.title: Joining a Game
narrative_steps.description: Taylor sees a suitable game and decides to join it.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Join' button next to the chosen game.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Taylor is added as the second player and redirected to the active game screen.

requirement_tested: Ability for users to undo their last move
user_persona: A player who just made a mistake.
user_goal: To undo the last move they made.

narrative_steps.title: Attempting Undo
narrative_steps.description: Casey realizes they moved to the wrong square and wants to take it back.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Undo Move' button beneath the board.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A confirmation dialog appears asking if Casey really wants to undo the move.

narrative_steps.title: Confirming Undo
narrative_steps.description: Casey confirms the undo action.
narrative_steps.action: Click 'Confirm' in the dialog.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The last move is reverted on the board and synced with the backend.

requirement_tested: Option for users to resign from a game
user_persona: A player who knows they're outmatched.
user_goal: To resign gracefully from a losing game.

narrative_steps.title: Initiating Resignation
narrative_steps.description: Riley sees no way out and decides to resign rather than continue.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Resign' button above the board.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A modal pops up confirming Riley's intent to resign.

narrative_steps.title: Confirming Resignation
narrative_steps.description: Riley confirms resignation in the modal.
narrative_steps.action: Click 'Confirm' in the resignation modal.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The game is marked as resigned, and the result screen is displayed.

requirement_tested: Interface controls for selecting different board themes
user_persona: A player who prefers a classic look.
user_goal: To switch the board theme to 'Classic Light'.

narrative_steps.title: Choosing Theme
narrative_steps.description: Morgan wants a cleaner look and selects a new theme.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Classic Light' option in the theme selector.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The board immediately updates to the Classic Light theme and the preference is saved server-side.

requirement_tested: Interface controls for selecting difficulty levels
user_persona: A beginner wanting a fair challenge.
user_goal: To set the game difficulty to Beginner mode.

narrative_steps.title: Setting Difficulty
narrative_steps.description: Pat wants an easier game and chooses the lowest difficulty.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Beginner' option in the difficulty selector.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The difficulty is adjusted for future AI interactions and saved to Pat's profile.

requirement_tested: Display area showing game history including all moves made
user_persona: A curious observer reviewing past moves.
user_goal: To review the sequence of moves made so far.

narrative_steps.title: Reviewing History
narrative_steps.description: Quinn scrolls through the move history panel to understand how the position was reached.
narrative_steps.action: Scroll through the game history sidebar.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Earlier moves become visible without triggering additional network requests.

requirement_tested: Section for viewing player statistics such as wins, losses, and win rate
user_persona: A competitive player checking their progress.
user_goal: To view personal win-loss record and overall performance.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Stats
narrative_steps.description: Robin opens the user menu and navigates to the stats section.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Stats' tab in the user menu.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Statistical overview including wins, losses, and win rate is displayed in charts and numbers.

requirement_tested: Real-time synchronization of game state between players
user_persona: One of two players making simultaneous moves.
user_goal: To see opponent's move appear instantly on the board.

narrative_steps.title: Receiving Opponent Move
narrative_steps.description: Sam waits for their opponent to make a move, watching the board.
narrative_steps.action: Wait for WebSocket event.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Opponent's move appears on Sam's board instantly with smooth animation.

requirement_tested: User authentication system to manage player sessions
user_persona: A returning player logging in to play again.
user_goal: To log in and resume playing.

narrative_steps.title: Logging In
narrative_steps.description: Terry clicks the sign-in link and enters their credentials.
narrative_steps.action: Click 'Sign In', enter email and password, then submit.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Terry is authenticated and redirected back to the home page with session active.

requirement_tested: Responsive layout styled with alice blue background and steel blue interface elements
user_persona: A mobile user accessing the app on a phone.
user_goal: To navigate the app comfortably on a small screen.

narrative_steps.title: Resizing Window
narrative_steps.description: Uma resizes the browser window to simulate mobile view.
narrative_steps.action: Resize the browser window.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Layout adjusts responsively, maintaining usability with alice blue background and steel blue accents.

requirement_tested: Configuration in package.json to install dependencies for both frontend and backend with 'npm run install:all'
user_persona: A developer setting up the project locally.
user_goal: To install dependencies for both frontend and backend in one command.

narrative_steps.title: Installing Dependencies
narrative_steps.description: Victor clones the repo and runs the unified install script.
narrative_steps.action: Run 'npm run install:all' in the terminal.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Dependencies for both frontend and backend are installed concurrently without errors.

requirement_tested: Configuration in package.json to start both frontend and backend concurrently with 'npm run dev'
user_persona: A developer beginning work on the project.
user_goal: To launch both frontend and backend servers together.

narrative_steps.title: Starting Development Servers
narrative_steps.description: Wanda prepares to develop by starting both apps at once.
narrative_steps.action: Run 'npm run dev' in the terminal.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Both frontend and backend servers start concurrently and are ready for development.

requirement_tested: A frontend application that fetches all dynamic data from backend APIs
user_persona: A user loading the latest game data.
user_goal: To see accurate, up-to-date information pulled from the backend.

narrative_steps.title: Fetching Game Data
narrative_steps.description: Xavier loads the game lobby and expects to see real-time data.
narrative_steps.action: Load the game lobby page.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Game list is fetched from backend API and displayed accurately.

requirement_tested: A backend application connecting to a PostgreSQL database using specified environment variables
user_persona: A system administrator verifying backend connectivity.
user_goal: To confirm the backend can connect to the database.

narrative_steps.title: Verifying Database Connection
narrative_steps.description: Yara checks that the backend uses correct environment variables to connect.
narrative_steps.action: Start the backend server with correct .env values.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Server initializes successfully and connects to PostgreSQL using DB_HOST, DB_PORT, etc.
